intro: Fleurya ingrata, commonly known as the stinking fleurya, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are often white or pale yellow. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
